title: Coursework
text: **Note: For my coursework, some githubs may appear missing if a professor privatizes a repository. Please email me to view any code not available on GitHub.

title: Coursework
text:
Big Data and Cloud Computing

Final Project
Each student was given Reddit data (all comments and submissions) from January 2021 to March 2023, roughly 1.5 Terabytes worth of data. There was then a subset of requirements as to what to do with the data but our topic was open ended.
My group focused on how Redditors discuss music, our work can be found here. I primarily focused on the genre based analysis as well as authoring much of our written segments.


Skills Developed and Tools Used

Python
AWS

Sagemaker
S3 Storage
Lambda

Azure

Machine Learning
Blob Storage

Apache Spark
Pyspark
DuckDB
Polars
Docker
Github

title: Coursework
text:
Advanced NLP

Final Project
Much of this course was focused on understanding the backend mechanics of NLP tools. Our project was then very open ended: to do something interesting with NLP. My group chose to develop of homophone checker, inspire by my common misuse of them in my writing.
The live demo and write-up can both be found on our final website. The code for the project is hosted on Github alongside our final presentation.


Skills Developed and Tools Used

Python
Huggingface
BERT
Spacy
Multivariable Calculus

title: Coursework
text:
Network Analytics

Final Project
Similar to my NLP course, our instructions for this project were very open ended. Having worked with Wikipedia’s network (each page as a node and each link as an edge) earlier in the semester, I was inspired to examine the first-link philosophy phenomena I had heard about. All of my findings can be found in my final paper and the code used to create my analysis is hosted on Github.


Skills Developed and Tools Used

Python
NetworkX
Ovito
HTML/Webscraping

title: Coursework
text:
Computer Vision

Final Project
For this course, each group worked on developing a deep learning model capable of detecting the number of birds in images from the Amazon rainforest. The challenge proved more difficult than the class was up to, none of us acquiring high accuracies. My groups final paper is hosted here and the code for this project can be found on Github


Skills Developed and Tools Used

Python
Google Colab
OpenCV
Pillow

title: Coursework
text:
Advanced Data Visualizations

Final Project
This class focused on best data visualization practices, culminating in a large group project to demonstrate our work. My group chose to focus on FDIC data to examine where US banking funds are located in hopes of teaching our viewers more about the US Banking System.
Our website is not publicly hosted but can be found here alongside our code on Github


Skills Developed and Tools Used

Python
R
Matplotlib
Plotly
Altair
ggplot
D3

title: Coursework
text:
Intro to DSAN

Final Project
Many of our assignments for this introductory course were worked into our final project, requiring our work to bend and twist to meet new requirements. Therefore, some of the pages may seem disconnected from the projects broader goals. However, I sought to use machine learning tools to project NBA players minutes as either continous variables or broken into categorical variables based on their stats. My final website can be found here. You may notice it was originally meant to serve as a portfolio but my website creation skills have greatly expanded since then. The code can be found on Github.


Skills Used and Tools Developed

Python
R
Scikit-Learn
Pandas
Matplotlib

Hi! My name is Austin. I am an Equity Research Associate at M Science covering Restaurants and AAPL. My primary focus is on DPZ, WEN, QSR, and PZZA. I currently live in the East Village in New York City. There, I spend my free time exploring local restaurants, going to the gym, and watching sports.Namely, I am a fan of the Denver Broncos, Georgetown Hoyas, and your 2023 NBA Champion Denver Nuggets. When I get the chance, I also love to ski.





I finished my latest education in May 2024, receiving a Master of Science in Data Science and Analytics from Georgetown University. In my graduate studies, I focused on Deep Learning, Large Language Models/NLP, and Network Analysis. You can read more on my coursework on the coursework page. I also completed my undergraduate studies at Georgetown, graduating in 2023 with a Bachelor of Arts in Economics and Philosophy. In undergrad, I was a four year member and director of membership for the Georgetown University Eating Society (GUES) and Sports Writer for The Hoya. My sports coverage took me as far as Indianapolis for the 2021 March Madness Tournament. I remain a fan of the Georgetown Hoyas, particularly the Men’s basketball team, despite their ongoing struggles.
